intro: Gymnosporia saharae, commonly known as the Saharan gymnosporia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Sahara Desert. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky resin. It is adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions through its ability to store water and reduce transpiration. Gymnosporia saharae plays a minor role in the local ecosystem, providing food and shelter for certain desert fauna.
